title: Premier League news live : Latest from Man United , Chelsea , Arsenal and build - up to Merseyside derby
body_text:
Manchester United takeover latest plus live updates from today’s Premier League press conferences
Summary
Qatari Sheikh Jassim Bin Hamad Al Thani and Sir Jim Ratcliffe have both made bids to take full control of the club.
The Glazer family, who have owned Manchester United since 2005, are considering selling the club as they “explore strategic alternatives”.
A soft deadline of 10pm (UK time) passed on Friday but more bids may have been made without official confirmation being publicised.
Follow live updates below, along with the latest news from around the Premier League.
- Sir Jim Ratcliffe makes official bid to complete full takeover of Manchester United
- Qatari Sheikh Jassim Bin Hamad Al Thani makes bid to take full control of Manchester United
- How has Sir Jim Ratcliffe done with his other clubs?
- Manchester United takeover fan survey
(Photo: Getty Images)
Sir Jim Ratcliffe makes official Manchester United bid
Sir Jim Ratcliffe has made an official bid to complete a full takeover of Manchester United.
Ratcliffe has joined Qatari Sheikh Jassim Bin Hamad Al Thani in making a bid for the Premier League club before today’s soft deadline.
Sources close to the bid say Ratcliffe wants to put “Manchester back into Manchester United” should he take over the Old Trafford club.
Read more below.
Julen Lopetegui wants Adama Traore to stay at Wolves
Julen Lopetegui has said he is keen for Adama Traore to stay at Wolverhampton Wanderers beyond the end of the season.
Traore, 27, is out of contract in the summer but Lopetegui is hopeful he signs an extension.
Lopetegui, speaking ahead of Wolves' encounter with Bournemouth on Saturday, said of the winger's future: “The club is working (on it) of course and we are happy with him.
“He’s working in a very good way. Sometimes starting on the bench, sometimes starting on the pitch, but he’s always ready and that’s a good thing for us.
“I hope that he continues with us, of course. I don’t know what is going to happen, because it’s about two parties, but I am happy with him and he knows that.
“I hope that he continues with us, that would be good news for me.
“We are happy with him. He has to improve more, as do the rest of the players, but it’s about wanting it and he wants it.”
Traore, who spent the second half of last season on loan at Barcelona, has scored two goals in 25 appearances for Wolves since returning to Molineux.
Seven of his 19 appearances in the Premier League this season have come from the start.
Qatari Sheikh Jassim Bin Hamad Al Thani makes bid to take full control of Manchester United
Sheikh Jassim Bin Hamad Al Thani, the chairman of Qatari bank QIB and son of the former Emir, has submitted a bid to complete a full takeover of Manchester United.
Sheikh Jassim, who says he is a lifelong Manchester United supporter, has pledged to invest in the football teams, training ground and stadium should he take control of the Premier League side. It is unknown how much he has bid.
Raine Group, the investment banking firm in charge of the sale of Manchester United on behalf of current owners the Glazer family, have set a soft deadline of 10pm (UK time) today for official interest to be formalised in writing. Ineos owner Jim Ratcliffe is also in the running and is likely to be the sheikh’s main competition.
Read more below.
Lee Mason leaves role as Premier League VAR
Lee Mason has left his role as a Premier League VAR official less than a week after his high-profile error during Arsenal’s draw with Brentford.
Mason, who officiated in the Premier League between 2006 and 2021 before taking up a role in the VAR booth, was stood down this weekend after Brentford’s equaliser at Arsenal was incorrectly given.
The 51-year-old failed to rule out Ivan Toney’s equaliser in the 1-1 draw.
Read more below.
Chelsea yet to apply for work permit for Santos
Chelsea are yet to apply for a work permit for Brazilian midfielder Andrey Santos, who it is expected will return to his home country on loan for the remainder of the season.
The 18-year-old joined from Vasco da Gama in the January transfer window as part of a hefty mid-season recruitment drive at Stamford Bridge.
Following his switch, Santos was given permission to take part in the Under-20 South American Championship — where he captained Brazil to the title and finished as top scorer.
Read more below.
Gambling company under fire for ‘mocking’ autism with Spurs advert
The gambling company Paddy Power has come under fire from two leading UK charities for an advertising campaign that featured a ‘Spurs Sensory Room’ as part of a “cheap jibe” that “mocked” people with autism.
The video, which was posted on Paddy Power’s YouTube channel, featured fans visiting a fictional ‘Spurs Sensory Centre’, that made light of the club’s lack of recent success.
The clip was removed from the company’s Twitter account but, at the time of publication, remained on their YouTube channel.
Sharp charged over ref comments after Wrexham win
Sheffield United striker Billy Sharp has been charged by the Football Association (FA) with improper conduct over comments he made following the club’s FA Cup win over Wrexham.
Sharp, who scored his side’s second goal in a late 3-1 fourth-round win earlier this month, accused referee Leigh Doughty of “helping (Wrexham) all night”.
The FA said his post-match comments in a television interview “imply bias and/or attack the integrity of the referee”.
Rodgers 'won't beg' Maddison to sign new Leicester deal
Leicester City manager Brendan Rodgers says he will “not beg” James Maddison to stay at the club, with contract talks yet to yield a conclusion.
Maddison has entered the final 18 months of his current deal and though Rodgers has continued to talk up his importance, the midfielder has yet to agree an extension.
Rodgers said: "We improve players and give them great conditions to work in. But I won’t be begging a player to stay. They get great support here and if they’ve been here, they understand what the club is about."
Full quotes below.
VAR controversy overshadowed Brentford’s performance against Arsenal – Thomas Frank
Thomas Frank believes the VAR controversy surrounding Brentford’s equaliser against Arsenal overshadowed his side’s performance.
Ivan Toney’s 74th-minute leveller was incorrectly allowed to stand after video assistant referee Lee Mason failed to draw offside lines when checking Christian Norgaard’s position.
Professional Game Match Officials Limited (PGMOL), the body responsible for match officials across English football, released a statement on Sunday confirming “human error” was responsible for the incident, as well as another in the game between Brighton and Crystal Palace.
Read the full quotes below.
Lallana out with leg injury for 'months'
Adam Lallana could be out for months due to a leg injury.
The 34-year-old midfielder, who last played for Brighton on January 21, will be out for the foreseeable future.
Danny Welbeck and Levi Colwill will also miss tomorrow's home match against Fulham.
Colwill could return for Brighton's FA Cup encounter with Stoke City on February 28.
Roberto De Zerbi, Brighton's head coach, said: "Adam Lallana has a big injury and we will lose him for a long time. Danny Welbeck is also unable to play. Levi Colwill could be back next game.
"Adam's injury is to the same part of leg. I think he will miss months."
777 Partners considering investment in Everton
Miami-based 777 Partners is considering an investment in Everton, according to sources close to the firm and the Premier League club.
The investment firm, led by managing partners Steven Pasko and Josh Wander, has built a multi-club network featuring Genoa in Italy, Vasco de Gama in Brazil, Standard Liege in Belgium and Red Star in France.
In November 2022, 777 reached an agreement to acquire a controlling stake of Hertha BSC, who sit 16th in the Bundesliga.
Aston Villa to check on Mings
Tyrone Mings faces a late fitness test ahead of Aston Villa’s game with Arsenal .
The 29-year-old, who signed a new three-and-a-half-year contract today, took part in the final training session of the week and will be in the squad for the Saturday lunchtime clash.
Manager Unai Emery says the centre-back will need a late check on the thigh injury that ruled him out of last week’s 3-1 defeat at Manchester City, though.
“He trained yesterday and today and he’s in the squad. We will now decide if he is ready to start."
Meanwhile, Bertrand Traore is in the squad for the first time since his loan was cut at Istanbul Basaksehir was cut short.
The winger will give Emery another attacking option to consider with the frontline current short on numbers following the sale of Danny Ings.
Diego Carlos also returned to full training this week after a lengthy absence with an achilles injury. The Brazilian, who turns 30 next month, has not featured since August.
Arsenal and Manchester City charged by FA
Both Arsenal and Manchester City have been charged by the FA after their players surrounded the match official at different times during their Premier League match at the Emirates Stadium on Wednesday.
Van Dijk set for Liverpool return against Newcastle
Liverpool are set to be boosted by the return of defender Virgil van Dijk against Newcastle United on Saturday.
Van Dijk has not played since he was taken off at half-time in the 3-1 defeat to Brentford on January 2 with a hamstring problem. At the time, Liverpool were optimistic the Netherlands international would return to action quickly, but the injury was worse than previously expected.
The centre-back was an unused substitute in Monday’s 2-0 Merseyside derby win over Everton after returning to training last week, but manager Jurgen Klopp believes he is now ready to feature from the off.
Karim Benzema and Toni Kroos not available for Real Madrid's match against Osasuna
Real Madrid striker Karim Benzema will not be available for Saturday's La Liga encounter against Osasuna.
Benzema scored twice in Real's 4-0 victory over Elche on Wednesday but was forced to come off in the 77th minute after appearing to be in discomfort.
The 35-year-old also played in only one of Real's two Club World Cup matches and the Frenchman now won't be available for tomorrow's match at the El Sadar Stadium.
Midfielder Toni Kroos, who missed Wednesday's match, will also not be able to play in this weekend's fixture due suffering from gastroenteritis. The 33-year-old is also a doubt for next week's Champions League tie against Liverpool as he is yet to resume first-team training.
Real have the chance to close the gap at the top of La Liga to five points with a victory over Osasuna, who haven't won in their last four outings.
(Photo: Getty Images)
Howe hoping Wilson and Willock will be fit for Carabao Cup final
Eddie Howe is hoping Newcastle United duo Callum Wilson and Joe Willock will be fit in time for the Carabao Cup final against Manchester United later this month.
Wilson, 30, missed last weekend’s 1-1 draw at Bournemouth with a minor hamstring injury. Willock, meanwhile, was forced off in the game due to a similar problem.
Speaking ahead of Saturday’s Premier League encounter against Liverpool, head coach Howe said he was optimistic that both will return for Newcastle’s first major cup final since 1999.
Who could become Manchester United's new owners?
It is a massive day for Manchester United supporters as the soft deadline set by the Glazers for prospective owners is 10 pm GMT today.
Here are some of the people who could be involved in the process....
VAR technician was partly to blame for John Brooks error during Crystal Palace vs Brighton
The mistake which saw Brighton & Hove Albion’s opening goal against Crystal Palace incorrectly chalked off for offside was due to the fault of a technician rather than VAR John Brooks.
Brooks was taken off VAR duty for Monday’s Merseyside derby between Liverpool and Everton as well as Manchester City’s win at Arsenal due to the error which saw Pervis Estupinan denied a legitimate goal.
But The Athletic has learned the mistake was not solely down to Brooks.
ICYMI: Manchester United duo Erik ten Hag and Marcus Rashford question officiating after Barcelona thriller
Erik ten Hag and Marcus Rashford have both criticised the refereeing during Manchester United’s 2-2 draw with Barcelona in the Europa League.
Ten Hag’s side played out a thrilling game against the La Liga leaders with both sides having a flurry of chances to win the match.
However, the referee, Maurizio Mariani, made several dubious calls during the game, including choosing not to send off Jules Kounde after the France international seemingly fouled Rashford who was clear on goal.
